peril.views

Interface View

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SlickGame

    public interface View
    This defines the behaviours of a object that will display the state of the Game to the user. The model elements should have their own visual counter parts that define how they are visualised and using Observer observe the model objects. The getModelView() is used to retrieve the ModelView which allows this mapping.
    Since:
    2018-02-20
    Version:
    1.01.03
    Author:
    Joshua_Eddy, Joseph_Rolli, Adrian_Wong
    See Also:
    ModelView, FileParser, GameController

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start()
    throws java.lang.Exception
        Starts the game and any visual Threads. This should be run after init(GameController).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - The Exception that may occur if the game fails to start correctly.

      • init

        void init(GameController game)
   throws java.lang.Exception
        Initialises the View using the GameController that allows interaction between the model and the View.
        Parameters:
        game - The GameController that allows the View to interact with the model of the game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - The Exception that may occur if the game fails to initialise correctly.

      • loadGame

        void loadGame()
       throws java.lang.Exception
        Causes the game to load from a map file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - The Exception that may be thrown from a corrupt map file.

      • setWinner

        void setWinner(ModelPlayer winner)
        Set a ModelPlayer as the winner of the game. This method will be called when the game determines that a ModelPlayer has won the game and this method should move the View to a visctory state.
        Parameters:
        winner - The ModelPlayer winner of the game.

      • setHelpMenuPage

        void setHelpMenuPage(int pageId)
        Set the View to display the help page with a specific id to the user.
        Parameters:
        pageId - The id of the page to be displayed.

      • updateChallenges

        void updateChallenges()
        Refresh the displayed versions of the Challenges. This will only be performed when a Challenge has been completed or removed.

      • addLoser

        void addLoser(ModelPlayer player)
        Sets a ModelPlayer as a loser of the game. The View should track the order in which the Players lost.
        Parameters:
        player - The ModelPlayer that has lost.

      • showToolTip

        void showToolTip(java.lang.String message)
        Displays a tool tip in a appropriate place that will convey an message to the user.
        Parameters:
        message - The message that will be displayed to the user.

      • toggleMusic

        void toggleMusic(boolean state)
        Toggles the state of the games music.
        Parameters:
        state - The state of the game's music, true is on.

      • toggleChallengeMenu

        void toggleChallengeMenu(boolean state)
        Toggles whether the menu that displays the Challenges to the user between hidden and visible.
        Parameters:
        state - The visibility state of the menu.

      • togglePauseMenu

        void togglePauseMenu(boolean state)
        Toggles whether the menu that displays the pause options to the user between hidden and visible. When the pause menu is visible isPaused() should return true.
        Parameters:
        state - The visibility state of the menu.

      • toggleWarMenu

        void toggleWarMenu(boolean state)
        Toggles whether the menu that displays the combat to the user between hidden and visible.
        Parameters:
        state - The visibility state of the menu.

      • toggleStatsMenu

        Toggles whether the menu that displays the ModelPlayer statistics to the user between hidden and visible.
        Parameters:
        state - The visibility state of the menu.

      • toggleUpgradeMenu

        void toggleUpgradeMenu(boolean state)
        Toggles whether the menu that displays the upgrades to a ModelCountry to the user between hidden and visible.
        Parameters:
        state - The visibility state of the menu.

      • toggleHelpMenu

        void toggleHelpMenu(boolean state)
        Toggles whether the menu that displays the help pages to the user between hidden and visible.
        Parameters:
        state - The visibility state of the menu.

      • nextHelpPage

        void nextHelpPage()
        Moves the help menu to the next page in the chain if there is one.

      • previousHelpPage

        void previousHelpPage()
        Moves the help menu to the previous page in the chain if there is one.

      • save

        void save()
        Cause the view to save the current state of the game. This should throw an Exception if called outside the core game loop.

        void exit()
        Exits the game immediately.

        Returns:
        The height of the screen.

      • getWindowWidth

        int getWindowWidth()
        Retrieves the width of the window that displays the game. If the isFullScreen() then this will be getScreenWidth().
        Returns:
        The width of the window that displays the game

      • getWindowHeight

        int getWindowHeight()
        Retrieves the height of the window that displays the game. If the isFullScreen() then this will be getScreenWidth().
        Returns:
        The height of the window that displays the game

      • isCurrentState

        boolean isCurrentState(ModelState state)
        Retrieves whether or not the specified ModelState is the current ModelState that the View is displaying to the user.
        Parameters:
        state - The ModelState to check.
        Returns:
        Retrieves whether or not the specified ModelState is the current ModelState.

      • isFullScreen

        boolean isFullScreen()
        Retrieves whether the game is full screen or not.
        Returns:
        The full screen state.

      • getModelView

        ModelView getModelView()
        Retrieves the ModelView that allows the reverse mapping from model object to their visual counter points.
        Returns:
        The ModelView.

      • getMapLoader

        FileParser getMapLoader(java.lang.String mapPath,
                        SaveFile save)
        Retrieves the FileParser that will load the game from memory. This FileParser should also generate the visual object and add them to the ModelView.
        Parameters:
        mapPath - The file path to the map folder.
        save - The SaveFile that is to be loaded.
        Returns:
        The FileParser that will load the game from memory.
